info.title: PlayFab Profiles API
info.description: All PlayFab entities have profiles, which hold top-level properties about the entity. These APIs give you the tools needed to manage entity profiles.

post.description: Gets the global title access policy
post.x-requestDetails: Retrieves the title access policy that is used before the profile's policy is inspected during a request. If never customized this will return the default starter policy built by PlayFab.

Given an entity type and entity identifier will retrieve the profile from the entity store. If the profile being retrieved is the caller's, then the read operation is consistent, if not it is an inconsistent read. An inconsistent read means that we do not guarantee all committed writes have occurred before reading the profile, allowing for a stale read. If consistency is important the Version Number on the result can be used to compare which version of the profile any reader has.

Given a set of entity types and entity identifiers will retrieve all readable profiles properties for the caller. Profiles that the caller is not allowed to read will silently not be included in the results.

post.description: Update the display name of the entity
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity profile, will update its display name to the one passed in if the profile's version is equal to or newer than the specified value

post.description: Sets the global title access policy
post.x-requestDetails: Updates the title access policy that is used before the profile's policy is inspected during a request. Policies are compiled and cached for several minutes so an update here may not be reflected in behavior for a short time.

post.description: Updates the entity's language. The precedence hierarchy for communication to the player is Title Player Account language, Master Player Account language, and then title default language if the first two aren't set or supported.
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity profile, will update its language to the one passed in if the profile's version is at least the one passed in.
This will set the access policy statements on the given entity profile. This is not additive, any existing statements will be replaced with the statements in this request.

ApiErrorWrapper.description: The basic wrapper around every failed API response

errorDetails.description: Detailed description of individual issues with the request object

EntityDataObject.description: An entity object and its associated meta data.

DataObject.description: Un-escaped JSON object, if DataAsObject is true.

EscapedDataObject.description: Escaped string JSON body of the object, if DataAsObject is default or false.

EntityKey.description: Combined entity type and ID structure which uniquely identifies a single entity.

CharacterId.description: The Character Id of the associated entity.

GroupId.description: The Group Id of the associated entity.

MasterPlayerAccountId.description: The Master Player Account Id of the associated entity.

NamespaceId.description: The Namespace Id of the associated entity.

TitleId.description: The Title Id of the associated entity.

TitlePlayerAccountId.description: The Title Player Account Id of the associated entity.

Action.description: The action this statement effects. May be 'Read', 'Write' or '*' for both read and write.

Comment.description: A comment about the statement. Intended solely for bookkeeping and debugging.

Condition.description: Additional conditions to be applied for entity resources.

Effect.description: The effect this statement will have. It may be either Allow or Deny

Principal.description: The principal this statement will effect.

Resource.description: The resource this statements effects. Similar to 'pfrn:data--title![Title ID]/Profile/*'

Created.description: The creation time of this profile in UTC.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the entity. This field may serve different purposes for different entity types. i.e.: for a title player account it could represent the display name of the player, whereas on a character it could be character's name.

EntityChain.description: The chain of responsibility for this entity. Use Lineage.

Permissions.description: The permissions that govern access to this entity profile and its properties. Only includes permissions set on this profile, not global statements from titles and namespaces.

VersionNumber.description: The version number of the profile in persistent storage at the time of the read. Used for optional optimistic concurrency during update.

EntityProfileFileMetadata.description: An entity file's meta data. To get a download URL call File/GetFiles API.

LastModified.description: Last UTC time the file was modified

ChildName.description: Child name value, if child statistic

GetEntityProfileRequest.description: Given an entity type and entity identifier will retrieve the profile from the entity store. If the profile being retrieved is the caller's, then the read operation is consistent, if not it is an inconsistent read. An inconsistent read means that we do not guarantee all committed writes have occurred before reading the profile, allowing for a stale read. If consistency is important the Version Number on the result can be used to compare which version of the profile any reader has.

DataAsObject.description: Determines whether the objects will be returned as an escaped JSON string or as a un-escaped JSON object. Default is JSON string.

Entity.description: The entity to perform this action on.

GetEntityProfilesRequest.description: Given a set of entity types and entity identifiers will retrieve all readable profiles properties for the caller. Profiles that the caller is not allowed to read will silently not be included in the results.

DataAsObject.description: Determines whether the objects will be returned as an escaped JSON string or as a un-escaped JSON object. Default is JSON string.

Entities.description: Entity keys of the profiles to load. Must be between 1 and 25

GetGlobalPolicyRequest.description: Retrieves the title access policy that is used before the profile's policy is inspected during a request. If never customized this will return the default starter policy built by PlayFab.

Permissions.description: The permissions that govern access to all entities under this title or namespace.

SetDisplayNameRequest.description: Given an entity profile, will update its display name to the one passed in if the profile's version is equal to or newer than the specified value

DisplayName.description: The new value to be set on Entity Profile's display name

Entity.description: The entity to perform this action on.

ExpectedVersion.description: The expected version of a profile to perform this update on

OperationResult.description: The type of operation that occured on the profile's display name

VersionNumber.description: The updated version of the profile after the display name update

SetEntityProfilePolicyRequest.description: This will set the access policy statements on the given entity profile. This is not additive, any existing statements will be replaced with the statements in this request.

Entity.description: The entity to perform this action on.

Statements.description: The statements to include in the access policy.

Statements.Comment: Allow my friends to read my avatar

Permissions.description: The permissions that govern access to this entity profile and its properties. Only includes permissions set on this profile, not global statements from titles and namespaces.

SetGlobalPolicyRequest.description: Updates the title access policy that is used before the profile's policy is inspected during a request. Policies are compiled and cached for several minutes so an update here may not be reflected in behavior for a short time.

Permissions.description: The permissions that govern access to all entities under this title or namespace.

SetProfileLanguageRequest.description: Given an entity profile, will update its language to the one passed in if the profile's version is at least the one passed in.

Entity.description: The entity to perform this action on.

ExpectedVersion.description: The expected version of a profile to perform this update on

Language.description: The language to set on the given entity. Deletes the profile's language if passed in a null string.

OperationResult.description: The type of operation that occured on the profile's language

VersionNumber.description: The updated version of the profile after the language update

GetEntityProfileRequest.description: Given an entity type and entity identifier will retrieve the profile from the entity store. If the profile being retrieved is the caller's, then the read operation is consistent, if not it is an inconsistent read. An inconsistent read means that we do not guarantee all committed writes have occurred before reading the profile, allowing for a stale read. If consistency is important the Version Number on the result can be used to compare which version of the profile any reader has.

SetProfileLanguageRequest.name: SetProfileLanguageRequest
SetProfileLanguageRequest.description: Given an entity profile, will update its language to the one passed in if the profile's version is at least the one passed in.

ApiErrorWrapper.description: This is the outer-wrapper for all responses with errors

code.description: The Http status code. If X-ReportErrorAsSuccess header is set to true, this will report the actual http error code.

status.description: The Http status code as a string.

None.name: None
None.description: This API requires no authentication headers (usually provides one to other calls).

SessionTicket.name: SessionTicket
SessionTicket.description: This API requires a client session ticket, available from any Client Login function.

SecretKey.name: SecretKey
SecretKey.description: This API requires a title secret key, available to title admins, from PlayFab Game Manager.

EntityToken.name: EntityToken
EntityToken.description: This API requires an Entity Session Token, available from the Entity GetEntityToken method.
